noscript.div: Javascript must be enabled for the correct page display

a.span: WDMCS schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 academic year. Read the latest update on how COVID-19/Coronavirus is impacting our WDMCS community.

li.a: English for Speakers of Other Languages
Become a Project-Based Learning Network Partner Today!

div.class: col-sm-10 col-sm-offset-1 col-md-3 col-md-offset-0 left--sidebar border--cornflower

li.a: Events Canceled Due to Coronavirus Outbreak

div.p: This is a comprehensive list of information and resources that families and staff in our communities may find beneficial. Please note that this page will continue to be updated throughout the West Des Moines Community Schoolsâ€™ temporary closure.

p.span: Â A public hotline has been established for Iowans with questions about COVID-19. The line is available 24/7 by calling 211.

div.p: Please click one of the links below to jump to the set of FAQs on that topic.

ul.li: grab-and-go meals, as well as home delivery
Hours: 11:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays
meals served at Clive, Crestview, Hillside, Indian Hills, Stilwell, and Valley

div.p: DMARC food pantries that are located in our communities include:

ul.li: grab-and-go meals; food rescue distribution is being suspended.

li.span: Hours
Mondays: 4-7 p.m.
Fridays: 9 a.m. to noon
Wednesdays (starting April 1): 4-6 p.m.

ul.li: pick up pre-bagged food in the parking lot, 2190 NW 82nd Street, Suite A, Clive

li.span: curbside food pantry model
Hours
Mondays: 8:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.
Tuesdays: 8:30 a.m. to 3 p.m.; 4-6 p.m. (evening time each second and fourth Tuesday)
Wednesdays: 8:30 a.m. to noon
Thursdays: 8:30 a.m. to 3 p.m.
Fridays: 8:30 a.m. to noon
pick up food at the back doors (southeast corner of building), 139 6th Street, West Des Moines

p.b: In a crisis, or if you are in need of immediate support:

li.span: call 911
contact Employee Family Resources (EFR) at 1-800-327-4692 (available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week)
contact Iowa Crisis Chat at

ul.li: contact the National Suicide Prevention Hotline at 1-800-273-8255 or https://suicidepreventionlifeline.org/Â

p.span: WDMCS partners with Employee & Family Resources (EFR) to support students, staff, and families through the Student Assistance Program and Employee Assistance Program.

ul.li: Employee Assistance Program: If you are looking to access the EAP, you can reach out to EFR via phone at 800-327-4692 or by email. In addition to phone and email, EFR has a web chat option here.Â Telehealth options are available in place of in-person counseling in many locations via Zoom or telephone effective March 18, 2020.

Student Assistance Program: 24/7/365 phone support available. Zoom or phone assessment, referral, and brief counseling sessions also available. Effective March 23, 2020, EFR will be offering SAP sessions by phone to students who have been seen onsite at their school. To access services, please call 515-244-6090.

div.h3: CASEL (Collaborative for Academic, Social, and Emotional Learning)

p.span: Social-emotional learning resources designed to support educators, parents, and anyone who works with children during this COVID-19 period. (designed for grades 6-12)
Social-emotional learning activities and practice resources, including themes of mindfulness, empathy, kindness & compassion, gratitude, and self-compassion. (designed for grades K-12)

a.span: Web Page: Greater Good in Educationâ€”Berkeley: All Practices

p.span: Some populations are more at risk for coronavirus, or impacts of social distancing. IDPH has provided resources and information for people facing additional risk.

p.a: Web Page: COVID-19 Resources for Underserved Populations

p.span: The National Association of School Psychologists has compiled talking points and tips for talking with children about COVID-19 (designed for grades K-12)

span.a: Web Page: Helping Children Cope With Changes Resulting From COVID-19Â

div.p: In response to COVID-19, PPTL has created a response campaign called Storms Donâ€™t Last Forever #SDLF with some online programming and resources for youth of all ages and educators.

p.a: Web page: Resources During COVID-19 for Youth, Families & Schools

div.p: In response to COVID-19, Polk County Health Services has provided these resources:
div.h3: UnityPoint Health Behavioral Health Urgent Care
div.p: Behavioral Health Urgent Care will open Monday, April 20. This clinic is adjacent to the Iowa Lutheran campus located at 1250 East 9th Street. UnityPoint Health â€“ Des Moines, along with Eyerly Ball Community Mental Health Services and Orchard Place/Child Guidance Center, will work to provide mental health, psychiatric evaluation and assessment, addiction medicine, crisis services and community resources to patients of all ages, both pediatric and adult.
The clinic will be open to patients from 10 a.m. â€“ 8 p.m., seven days a week. This is a walk-in site of care, no appointments available at this time.

p.a: Website: UnityPoint Health â€“ Des Moines

div.h3: University of Iowa Tele Mobile Clinic
div.p: This is a University of Iowa student-run nonprofit organization that offers free basic healthcare services to anyone who needs it. They provide:
Patients do not need insurance. Services are available in English, Spanish, Arabic and French. Call or text 319-535-2684 to sign up.
Follow the WDMCS Technology Department blog for technology-related COVID-19 updates and all things tech about WDMCS.
If your child qualifies for free or reduced school lunches, you could qualify for discounted home internet from Mediacom as low as $10 per month.

li.span: (en espaÃ±ol/English)
Iowa Department of Revenue:
Iowa Workforce Development:
COVID-19 Community Economic Relief fund (support for bills, rent, and food)

Iowa State University: Polk County Extension and Outreach Online Resources (reliable, research-based resources including resources for/about kids and youth, health and wellbeing, agriculture, and economic development, plus hotlines)Â
All City of Clive buildings, including the Clive Public Library, are closed from March 18 through at least April 12.
Increasing the frequency of cleaning and disinfecting in City facilities.
Installing informative safety signage throughout City facilities.
Whenever possible, conducting business and meetings by phone or online.
For updates and additional information, please follow the City of Clive on
The Clothes Closet is closed to clients and donors. Please hold your donation until a later date.
Drop off items for donation at office, open:
Mondays: 9:30 a.m. to 7 p.m.
Wednesdays: 9:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.
Fridays: 9 a.m. to noon.
Please call ahead to ensure someone is in the office: 515-257-8550.
You can also email
to arrange drop off or pick up.

ul.li: The West Des Moines Public Library is closed for four weeks. During the closure, the library plans to do daily storytimes and read-alouds, and publish recommended content on its Facebook page.

li.span: For updates and additional information, please follow the City of West Des Moines on
and

a.span: Website: City of West Des Moines

li.span: Clothing Closet: The Clothing Closet is closed to clients and donors. Please hold your donation until a later date. Please call 515-222-3663 if you have a specific donation you would like to drop off.
Program Outreach/Emergency Assistance Services: These services have been temporarily suspended. Please contact Program Outreach staff via phone or email to discuss your situation:
Tami Lage: 515-222-3664 or
Stephanie Corbett: 515-222-3662 or
Â Â Â Â Â Â
Transportation: Transportation is not provided for those with cold or flu-like symptoms. Please call your healthcare provider if you are feeling ill.
Free Medical Clinic: The free medical clinic is closed through Tuesday, March 31.
ELL Classes: These classes have been delayed by four weeks. A tentative start date has been set for Tuesday, April 21.
Friendship Connection: All activities have been canceled through March.

a.span: Website: West Des Moines Human Services

li.span: Effective Monday, March 16, the City of Windsor Heights will restrict public access to City Hall and the Public Safety Building. The City asks anyone needing to conduct business at City Hall call first at 515-279-3662 to discuss the process for such business. For Public Safety administrative needs, please call 515-286-3632.Â
For updates and additional information, please follow the City of Windsor Heights on
and

div.class: col-sm-3 col-md-3 right--sidebar border--orange sidebar--style01 visible-print

div.p: To stay up-to-date with COVID-19-related updates from WDMCS, watch our "COVID-19/Coronavirus Information" web page and download the free WDMCS app on your phone (Google Play or App Store).
This page provides information, maps, and resources about the coronavirus response in our local area: www.coronavirus.iowa.gov.

ul.li: 3550 Mills Civic Parkway, West Des Moines, IA 50265
